channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Inflation rose less than expected in September, the U.S. belatedly reports
item.description: The federal government recalled some furloughed workers specifically to produce the inflation report, which plays a key role for Social Security beneficiaries.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government recalled some furloughed workers specifically to produce the inflation report, which plays a key role for Social Security beneficiaries.

(Image credit: FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Federal workers go without pay today. And, NBA stars arrested for illegal gambling
item.description: Today, millions of federal workers are missing their first full paycheck since the shutdown began. And, an NBA gambling scandal has led to the arrest of over 30 people.
item.content:encoded:
Today, millions of federal workers are missing their first full paycheck since the shutdown began. And, an NBA gambling scandal has led to the arrest of over 30 people.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Boo to spooky chocolate prices! It's the year of chewy, fruity Halloween treats
item.description: Sales of non-chocolate candy are growing faster than those of chocolate. With cocoa in shortage, manufacturers are changing pack sizes, adding fillers and dipping candy in "white creme."
item.content:encoded:
Sales of non-chocolate candy are growing faster than those of chocolate. With cocoa in shortage, manufacturers are changing pack sizes, adding fillers and dipping candy in "white creme."

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: No historic museums were harmed in the making of this quiz. Can you score 11?
item.description: From brazen jewel heists to internet meltdowns, this week brought travesties galore.
item.content:encoded: From brazen jewel heists to internet meltdowns, this week brought travesties galore.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: It's supposed to be payday for many federal workers. Instead, they're getting nothing
item.description: Roughly 1.4 million federal workers are going without pay due to the government shutdown. About half of them are furloughed, while the other half has been deemed essential and is working without pay.
item.content:encoded:
Roughly 1.4 million federal workers are going without pay due to the government shutdown. About half of them are furloughed, while the other half has been deemed essential and is working without pay.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner/WAMU)
item.dc:creator: Jenny Abamu

item.title: Here's what experts say 'A House of Dynamite' gets wrong (and right) about nuclear war
item.description: Some praised realistic elements like the depiction of the White House situation room. But others said parts of the plot didn't ring true.
item.content:encoded:
A House of Dynamite is available online for streaming on October 24. Experts say the sets, such as this one of the White House situation room's watch floor, are "scarily authentic."'/>

Some praised realistic elements like the depiction of the White House situation room. But others said parts of the plot didn't ring true.

(Image credit: Eros Hoagland)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Not sure how to support a friend with cancer? Survivors have advice
item.description: To help a loved one with cancer, think about what you're good at — and what they need. Are you organized? Plan their meals. Detail-oriented? Go with them to appointments. Survivors share ideas.
item.content:encoded: To help a loved one with cancer, think about what you're good at — and what they need. Are you organized? Plan their meals. Detail-oriented? Go with them to appointments. Survivors share ideas.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: As strikes on alleged drug boats grow, so do questions about their legality and goal
item.description: President Trump says he has authority to carry out the strikes, but international experts are asking if the attacks are truly about countering narcotics or instead toppling Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he has authority to carry out the strikes, but international experts are asking if the attacks are truly about countering narcotics or instead toppling Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: An enduring love born amidst early Alzheimer's
item.description: Joanna Fix and Forrest Fix of Colorado Springs talk about living with Alzheimer's disease. They say it's all about learning how to live with it, not die from it.
item.content:encoded: Joanna Fix and Forrest Fix of Colorado Springs talk about living with Alzheimer's disease. They say it's all about learning how to live with it, not die from it.
item.dc:creator: Von Diaz

item.title: Trump says he's ending trade talks with Canada over TV ads
item.description: The abrupt announcement comes after Trump accused Canada of using a "fake" Ronald Reagan ad to sway U.S. courts, raising the stakes in an already tense trade dispute.
item.content:encoded:
The abrupt announcement comes after Trump accused Canada of using a "fake" Ronald Reagan ad to sway U.S. courts, raising the stakes in an already tense trade dispute.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
